channel.title: MCFC News
channel.description: All the latest news from Manchester City FC

item.title: e-foods backing Santa Stroll
item.description: City’s outstanding community work has helped secure even more support for this Sunday’s fundraising extravaganza, the 2011 Santa Stroll.

item.title: Happy birthday, Nigel!
item.description: Nigel de Jong celebrated his 27th birthday at Carrington today by blowing out the candles on his cake.

item.title: Christmas spirit in City Square on Saturday
item.description: We’ll be getting festive in City Square this Saturday as the top-of-the-table Blues prepare to take on Norwich City.

item.title: Heated debate raises temperatures
item.description: We're into another cup semi-final but a "frank exchange of views" after the final whistle has predictably grabbed the headlines.

item.title: Young Blues hoping for long cup run
item.description: City's Under-18s begin what they hope will be a long FA Youth Cup campaign this evening with a third round home tie against Corby Town.

item.title: Boss happy as cup win sets up busy spell
item.description: Roberto Mancini has his eyes on a busy couple of months with the prospect of another visit to Wembley after his City side battled through to the Carling Cup semi-finals.

item.title: Arsenal 0-1 City
item.description: A patient City left it late to edge into the semi-finals of the Carling Cup with this hard-fought win in north London, our first away to the Gunners since 1975.

item.title: Music Magpie swoops in for Santa Stroll
item.description: Just as the Santa Stroll will bring City fans together to have fun and raise some much needed funds for  City In The Community, we’ve also teamed up with musicMagpie.co.uk to keep the spirit of the day going and make raising money for CITC as much fun as the stroll itself.

item.title: Champions League watch: Bayern slip up
item.description: With just one round of Champions League games remaining, we take a look at how City’s Group A opponents got on in their domestic leagues this week.

item.title: Blue Peters relishing City return
item.description: Corby Town’s Under 19s manager Mark Peters has highlighted the challenge that lies ahead for his side as they take on City in the FA Youth Cup third round.
